video.title: Strapi & GatsbyJS Course - Portfolio Project
video.description:
Learn to use Gatsby and Strapi to code a portfolio project in this full course. Strapi is the most popular open-source Headless CMS and is based on Node.js. Gatsby allows developers to quickly build very fast static websites and apps. Both use JavaScript.

🎥 Gatsby Tutorial: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kzWIUX3CpuI

💻 Starter Code: https://github.com/john-smilga/strapi-gatsby-porfolio-2020-api
🔗 View completed project: https://gatsby-strapi-portfolio-project.netlify.app/

✏️ Course created by John Smilga. Check out his YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/codingaddict

🔗 John Smilga's website: https://www.johnsmilga.com

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (00:00) Intro
⌨️ (04:47) Dev Setup
⌨️ (07:19) Starter Info
⌨️ (20:31) Navbar

⌨️ (56:44) First Content Type
⌨️ (1:07:09) First Content

⌨️ (2:31:12) Blog Content-Type

⌨️ (2:49:45) Blog List 
⌨️ (2:54:02) Blog Component 
⌨️ (2:58:42) Blog Page 
⌨️ (3:03:49) Create Blog Pages Programmatically 
⌨️ (3:10:34) Blog Template

⌨️ (4:02:58) Error Page

⌨️ (5:10:30) Twitter Cards

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: Coding Addict
topLevelComment.text:
Starter Project
https://github.com/john-smilga/starter-project-gatsby-strapi-portfolio-2020

Please keep in mind, that you will need a complete strapi-api (all content-types with at least one instance of data) to run finished project.
Source Code
https://github.com/john-smilga/gatsby-strapi-portfolio-site-2020

Please look at readme.md for claudinary instructions.

https://github.com/john-smilga/strapi-gatsby-porfolio-2020-api

topLevelComment.author: Oleksii K
topLevelComment.text: For now, we don`t have access to backend in the project, don't spend your time :(

topLevelComment.author: Innocent Maina
topLevelComment.text: This is one of the videos that I will never forget !!!

topLevelComment.author: Shameek Agarwal
topLevelComment.text: it would be very helpful if someone can please verify few of my doubts - 1. when we use strapi + gatsby, its not like our gatsby makes request to strapi. the data of strapi is just "bundled" with gatsby in a way. 2. when we used images, we could use the childImageSharp query for "projects", while we couldnt do so for "individual blogs" - i think here is why - a. in "projects" case, we use the "bundled data" by strapi so we can display images. b. in "individual blog" case, we cannot just use that image as we cannot use the Image component of gatsby, its just an tag, with src which needs to point to a valid url, which is why we had to use cloudinary.

topLevelComment.text: dont see the Create (collection/single/new) component options? why is that?

topLevelComment.author: Shervin Mokthari
topLevelComment.text: killer tutorial FreeCodeCamp & John Smilga !

topLevelComment.author: Marcus James Reed
topLevelComment.text: When I uploaded my image, it successfully uploaded to Cloudinary, but when I view the image in my blog post, it appears small and distorted. What happened?

replies.author: Marcus James Reed
replies.text: I was not able to use the new configuration that they give in the configurations at https://www.npmjs.com/package/strapi-provider-upload-cloudinary, it breaks somehow... but it works just fine with the method you use in the video.

replies.author: Marcus James Reed
replies.text: Nevermind...I found the problem. In your css, you have defined width and height properties of 15rem for the blog image for some reason.  I changed them to width: 100%;  height: auto;and the image appears correctly

topLevelComment.author: Marcus James Reed
Marcus James Reed
topLevelComment.text: Why does a black outline appear on the job links?  I had to set outline: 0; to eliminate it.

topLevelComment.author: Umberto Di Napoli
topLevelComment.text: I got "AssertionError [ERR_ASSERTION]: Cannot wrap non-Error object" when try to upload image to cloudnary, I follow the new instructions on npm as you said, there is something wrong?

replies.author: Umberto Di Napoli
replies.text: SOLVED: just remove "env()" from assignation in the ./cofig/plugins.js (for better maintenance, use a .env file)

topLevelComment.author: Shalaw Fatah
topLevelComment.text:
hey John, thanks for the great work! 
I would like to know if there is a way that I we can update the portfolio through the Strapi backend? What I'm saying is that when you insert a new blog/project/ or post, the website gets updated directly, without the need of [gatsby build] thing? I appreciate your answer. Best.
